intro: Stereospermum katangense, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical tree native to Central and East Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant yellow flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that are typically harvested when they turn yellow or orange, containing a sweet, juicy pulp surrounded by a fibrous layer. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
